title: 110_hr2893
content: The "Homeownership Affordability Act of 2007" may be cited as the short title. It includes provisions for qualified homeowner downpayment assistance. The "Homeownership Affordability Act of 2007" includes provisions for qualified homeowner downpayment assistance, defined as a gift of cash for a downpayment on a principal residence for a qualified taxpayer. The "Homeownership Affordability Act of 2007" allows qualified taxpayers to receive downpayment assistance for a principal residence, limited to 20% of 110% of the maximum allowable principal obligation for the property's area. A qualified taxpayer is defined as someone with a modified adjusted gross income within specified limits. The "Homeownership Affordability Act of 2007" allows qualified taxpayers to receive downpayment assistance for a principal residence if their adjusted gross income does not exceed $110,000 ($220,000 for joint returns). Contributions for downpayment assistance are not eligible for charitable deductions under the Internal Revenue Code.
